title: Compile fpm with `--symtab-only`
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/592

Here is the current status:
```console
$ fpm build --compiler=lfortran --flag="--symtab-only"
 + mkdir -p build/lfortran_A138861DEFDF6F10/fpm
 + cc -c ./src/filesystem_utilities.c  -o build/lfortran_A138861DEFDF6F10/fpm/src_filesystem_utilities.c.o
 + lfortran -c ./src/fpm_strings.f90  --symtab-only -J build/lfortran_A138861DEFDF6F10/fpm -I build/lfortran_A138861DEFDF6F10/fpm  -o build/lfortran_A138861DEFDF6F10/fpm/src_fpm_strings.f90.o
input:35:1 semantic error: The symbol 'input_unit' not found in the module 'iso_fortran_env'

^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
<ERROR> Compilation failed for object " src_fpm_strings.f90.o "
<ERROR>stopping due to failed compilation
STOP 1
```

This only parses the declarations (ignores executable statements) and should not be too much work to get fully working. Once we can do that, we can then write tools for automatically documenting (collaboration with FORD) etc.
